content.body: do you ever need that outside of tests?
I have never needed that outside of tests
what's it matter? people writing tests are valid users of the language
I am generally opposed to adding features to browsers which will not be used in browsers
I am happy to have it in WinterCG or whatever
does WinterCG add prototype methods to existing built-ins?
no reason they couldn't but also they could just add `assert.equals` and define its behavior for TAs
content.formatted_body: no reason they couldn't but also they could just add assert.equals and define its behavior for TAs

content.body: we could certainly add a feature as normative optional, and HTML could make it prohibited in browsers

> <@bakkot:matrix.org> I have never needed that outside of tests

Yes, I wrote one a few months ago that’s used in prod. We’re doing basic crypto signature validations
